intro: Calyptrostegia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in racemes, characteristic of the mustard family. Calyptrostegia angustifolia is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
